intro: Cephaelis cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cephaelis, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are elliptical and have a glossy surface, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
